div.span: NRAC 3-8 Student Council Thank You Video

br.span: The NRAC 3-8 Student Council created a “Thank you” video to acknowledge all of the people who are instrumental in seamlessly helping the transition into these uncertain times. CLICK HERE to watch the video.

Kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 academic school year opens online Monday, April 27, 2020 at 6 a.m. and will close Friday, May 15, 2020. In order for your student to attend Kindergarten, they must be five years old by September 30, 2020. CLICK HERE to enroll in the Early Childhood Learning Community Kindergarten program.
CLICK HERE to view a COVID-19 resource page which features updates from the District, student academic content, and information for staff.
CLICK HERE to watch the following video as Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio addresses the class of 2020.
CLICK HERE to read a message from Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio regarding Ohio Governor Mike DeWine's decision to have an extended closing period for schools.
CLICK HERE to read a letter from Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio regarding the steps the District is taking to ensure a safe learning environment.

div.span: Liberty and ECLC Earn State Board of Education Awards

br.span: The North Ridgeville City Schools are proud to announce that Liberty Elementary earned the Overall A Award and the Early Childhood Learning Community earned the Overall A and All A Award by the State Board of Education for the second-straight year. CLICK HERE to learn about the awards.

div.span: Substitute Teachers and Support Staff Needed

br.span: The North Ridgeville City Schools are in need of substitute teachers and substitute support staff. CLICK HERE to be directed to the Human Resources page to learn about the job opportunities.
The North Ridgeville Academic Center Community Gym is open to the public. CLICK HERE for more information about the hours of operation.
